title: CORKI E AP RATIO
body: It does half physical and half magic with a 10% AD ratio. I think it should have a 10% AP ratio too. It's Corki's only ability without an AP ratio.

replies.body: It would improve build diversity a little but AP would remain suboptimal overall. If Nocturne gets an AP scaling on his passive, why not 10% on Corki's E?
Noc's AP is on his E Unspeakable Horror. And that was most likely for Triforce ~~ya know back when Tri gave AP ~~
They added a 15% AP ratio on his passive in 6.10.
It was for rageblade. They said that while he might not want to build rageblade, this would allow him to be a teeny bit stronger if he so chooses to build it
That was also in the time that blue buff gave flat AP and most junglers would get 30~ AP they can do nothing with.
I don't think that would affect Noc's balance even remotely though. After all, most Nocturne's should be giving blue to their mid laners

While people shouldn't stay in his full E duration anyway, that would be a ridiculous ratio if it's how it works. It merits some AP ratio but perhaps only 1% in that case. 

I'm not really sure how practical 160% total AP would be to use since E has a 16 sec. CD and they'd have to sit in it for 4 seconds. I think it actually sounds scarier than it really is. Still,  I'd rather make sure it's a low enough ratio that it doesn't have the potential to be a problem.

I think 5% would be fine.  1% would be a total of 16% which is pretty darn weak.  5% gives a total of 80% which is not only a fairly reasonable scaling for many abilities, but is a much nicer looking number.

Honestly I think 60% would be the optimal overall ratio, but that's a kind off ratio to have displayed (3.75%).

When i play corki i usually find it pretty easy to keep it on someone for atleast 3 seconds, 4 is about the time they realize their fucked XD And even then in a teamfight it's easy to keep people in it for 4 full seconds.

I disagree. He does hybrid damage but he's not a champion you build as a hybrid. His AD ratios are far better than his AP ratios and he's one of the few champions who gets tons of magic damage without building any AP. I think he's in a good spot right now but the next time he gets too strong or too weak, instead of nerfing/buffing they should fix him to actually have real hybrid ratios. a 5% AP ratio would be 80% AP for one of the riskiest abilities in the entire game so I think it's fair.

Yeah i mean to be fair though i kind of want more Hybrid champs in the future to be like Corki, overall i think he's a good base line for hybrids cause he still does both types of damage but he doesn't have that thing where he can literally build anything and it works perfectly like Jax. Like i want more abilities to actually say "Oh hey this does half/half damage or this ability does mixed damage."

Yeah I love that about Corki, I think he's perfect besides his ratios. Being able to stack nothing but AD and do far more magic damage than physical damage is just odd, but if he had more practical AP ratios I think the half/half damage on his AAs and E is very cool.
Corki doesn't really need buffs right now, but if he ever does this would be fun.

I think they should increase regular R AP ratio because they gutted it's base damage and TF lost its AP stat. the ap magic pen corki was basically gutted since of his rework, and it would be cool to have it back

You do that he becomes hyper broken. There's a reason they've barely touched the guy despite him struggling all year... like Tristana

I hated the ADC _"update"_ from preseason last year

10% AP on E would do nothing except make AP off builds more viable. When he was strong, it certainly wasn't because of his abilities' AP scaling. It was due to having 1.1 AD scaling on autos with half magic and half physical. This made crit builds with Essence Reaver (back when TF had 20% crit. ) extremely effective vs non-tanks. I also think he was overrated and his actual competitive winrate didn't match people's perception of him. They looked at him laning well and bursting a lot of champions but didn't realize how relevant the lack of CC becomes later on.  

Corki's got a decent winrate now (51% mid and ADC) but he's not close to being broken by any means. He's just OK and still suffers from a huge late game fall-off. Few play him and they mostly know what they're doing while their opponents probably forgot how Corki works. Moreover, Corki beats a lot of the reworked assassins, especially pre-6 so the meta fits him. Having a gap closer and being ranged is always hard for assassins. If he were OP, you'd see him back at 10%+ playrate instead of 3%.

I'm not really sure if corki's E is really intended to be a full on damaging ability. I think it's more intended for it's other passive ability resistance shredding. Sorta like a darius E.
Did you know that every damage proc that is physical on corki's e counts towards black cleaver? Idk what this would mean in terms of corki builds but I do think that this is interesting.

Corki's already a hybrid champion. His Q has a 50% AP and 50% AD ratio. The E always seemed like an odd duck with only a 10% AD ratio.

This kind of buff would have almost no practical significance since TF no longer has AP and the only AP items he really builds are GB and sometimes Void. However, it would certainly make it seem more consistent with his kit.
